Posts.Content: Thanks Mistymoley, Definately taking  phone and charger, have added  bottle of squash to my list as well now ! Got sweets, baby wipes, and Ipod and a little cushion on my list to sort out.! thanks again Wendy x
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: yup! ear plugs are now on the list next to Ipod ! thank you !! Wendy
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: Hi Janice, I have just ordered a V shaped pillow from Amazon with a pillow case all for £9.98 good price I thought ! so hopefully that will arrive just before I go in Hospital. Thanks for that advise, sounds like a good idea , as I always sleep on my tummy or my side, never on my back, so will try this pillow to see if I can mange to sleep on my back with it ! sitting slightly up I suppose ! Will they let me take a little cushion into hospital with me? or is that for when I get home? Good luck with the radiotherapy, not sure if Ive got to have that yet, but probably will , most people seem to. Thanks for the advice. big hug ! Wendy
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: Hi Suzy ! I thought you were going away for a few days break ! When are you going? When you do, try to have a nice time, hard to do when youve got all this going on, but its a nice idea ! Ive been told I could be in for at least 3 days maybe longer as they are putting in the implant at the same time, so it will depend on healing, drains etc etc  ! My shopping list is getting bigger, will need a suitcase soon ! Will send you a PM before Friday ! Wendy xx
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: At last have my appointment for MX and lymph node clearance this Friday, 23/3/12 (have IDC) I have the letter but what should I take in with me?? no advice on letter !  I dont even know how long I will be there for ! I am having expander implant at same time. Any good advice as to what to take in with me?  apart from PJs and slippers? Thanks Wendy
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: Thanks Jan Jan, now added money, and perfume, may not bother with make up as Im right handed and wont be able to put it on very well !  thats the side they are chopping off along with all my axillary nodes ! Wendy x
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: Thank Always17 Now added notebook and pen, and soft towel ! Wendy x
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: Hi there, I take Lyrica which is pregablin, I was given this about 4 weeks after last Tax by my GP, mainly for the neuropathy in my feet (i have red hot sore tingling feet all the time, also hip pain) The Lyrica seems to help with the foot problems, but not my hip aches, They have increased dosage from 75mg twice a day to 100mg twice a day in the last 2 weeks, as your body gets used to it and you need to increase dosage after a few weeks. I still have to take co-codomol in the mornings though as hip pains are really bad still, especially in the mornings, and I am 9 weeks from my last Tax. So the side effects dont always go away immediatly with some people, like me, unfortunately. Hope it works out better for you. Good luck with the rest of your Tax. Wendy x
Posts.Title: Docetaxel and Pregabalin?

Posts.Content: Hi Jules, Im glad you posted this question, Im due to see the plastic surgeon next Tuesday, regarding the same as you (only they want to do mine at the same time as MX)  So hopefully you will get the answers that I need too ! Good luck Wendy
Posts.Title: what reconstruction to have

Posts.Content: How do they determine small boobs or big boobs, I think mine are smallish -36c, is that why they want to use by belly fat rather than anything else?
Posts.Title: Immediate or delayed recon?

Posts.Content: Hi Barbara, just saw this question as am I am at your hospital, I only waited 2 weeks from coming out of hospital after MX (mind you they did keep me in for 2 weeks after MX as had drains, so in total, it was just under 4 weeks from MX to first chemo.  Hope this helps....   Wendy x
Posts.Title: Waiting!

Posts.Content: Wishing you all the best Lorna, Im still waiting for mine, hopefully wont be too far behind you, let me know how you get on with the reconstruction, as thats what my consultant suggests for me too, You can be my advisor!  Big hugs Wendy
Posts.Title: MX tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi VJ This waiting is so hard, isnt it, I still dont know to what extent, my breast cancer is, all I know is that ive got it, got to have a mastectomy, dont know when yet, dont know grade or size yet, how advanced it is or what. i do know its DCIS and its also invasive according to the core biopsy.The lump feels about 2" accross so its quite big from my diagnosis. I had my sentinal nodes removed on Friday (I have now spent all evening and part of the night in loo, with bad stomach ! not sure if that is supposed to happen with the radio active dye of whether the hospital food did it! I have an appointment on Thursday with the plastic surgeon to talk about re-construction, Im thinking why ???????????? Surely I need to know the extent of my cancer first and whether its worth having a re construction? I havent had a MRI scan, most people on here seem to have had one, I was diagnosed on the 1st February, as 99% probable, confirmed on the 8th Feb, sentinal node removal on the 17th Feb, now plastic surgeon on the 28th Feb, I appear to be missing the results somewhere along the line of the results of whether its spread to lymph nodes ! Maybe the plastic surgeon may know? its all so confusing. How long is it since youve been diagnosed? and at what point did you have an MRI scan? Anyone else here in the same situation as me??
Posts.Title: Waiting.....

Posts.Content: Hi VJ I just wrote you a long message, but it disapeared! so dont know if you got it or not!  Yes lets keep in touch and compare notes ! Hopefully we will know more by next weekend. I will ask about the MRI scan, to see why I havent been offered one, just MX, so maybe what I have shows up easily from the core biopsy. Have you had your sentinel nodes removed for testing yet? or do you not need to? I came out of hospital after one night in, expecting a very sore arm, which it is, but feel a lot worse after picking up a gastro bug in there aswell! spent all last night and most of the day visiting the loo ! im not sure what hurts most underarm or tummy pains !! Good luck with your appointment next week, and we will chat soon ! Take care Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Waiting.....

Posts.Content: Hi Archies mum, Yes, I will demand some answers, all I really am sure of is that ive got to have the MX, but maybe if the sentinel nodes they just took out are infected too, then I will have to have some drug of some sort I suppose, not to shrink it though, havent been offered that. Are you going to have re-construction at the same time if you have a MX? have you decided yet? Good luck on your journey, Wendy x
Posts.Title: Waiting.....

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy,  Brilliant news ! I will definately do it again on the 29th, I sort of keep thinking .... oh, why should I bother with it, I expect the hair will fall out anyway ! but you are the first person that Ive heard of that has actually kept their hair after all 6 FECS ! so will persevere and see ! Ive got 2 wigs at the ready, but I really dont mind if I dont have to use them !!! Thanks for that Mandy. Hope you are recovering well, and are having a good life now !
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Im not sure that it was the cold cap that gave me the horrid headache, apparently you can get it from the chemo as well, so Im glad Ive tried it, and we will see in 14 - 17 days to see if it works ! Wendy
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: I had it on Tuesday, strange, my hospital never suggested anything about a rogue cell, in fact  they positively encouraged using it.so I did ! Strange how different hospiyals have diferent ideas doesnt it! Wendy xx
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Good morning ! I just got Natural Senna Laxatives from Boots, which did the trick, but I am going to ask chemo nurse next time what is the best type to take, and if its available on prescription, gotta save when you can ! now prescriptions are free to us and off work so much !
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Hi, had the cold cap yesterday for the first time, after 10 minutes its ok, I found mine pressed on the forehead and was quite uncomfortable, but I think that was due to the straps being too tight, I shifted the strap up a bit after about 3 hours and found that was a bit better ! (should have done it sooner). I must confess I still have a horrible headache, that came on about 8 pm last night, and had it all night and its still there this morning, but going to take a painkiller now as had enough of it ! as well as the feeling sick from the chemo! I wasnt sure if I could take any pain relief last night, what with all the drugs and anti sickness pills, so I left it, but have now taken some co-codomol as cant put up with it any longer !  have to wait for day 14 - 17 to see if it works, at least that is before the next chemo, so will know if I need to put up with it again in 3 weeks time ! Hope that helps! Wendy
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Hi Kitty, Good luck for your first cycle ! and dont be like me, take laxatives as from day after, believe me you will need them ! I didnt and nearly exploded by 4th day ! ended up taking overdose of Senna and not really feeling very good for another 4 days because of the opposite !!! I now have a very sore rear end !!! Keep in touch, will send a friend request. Wendy x
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Hi Pixie, thats encouraging news, still got hair after 3 FEC ! I hope I can be like you too ! Ive only had 1 FEC so far, and only 1 week ago, so its early days yet ! I didnt find the cold bothered me, thats my only worry in that department , perhaps it wasnt cold enough ! and it wont work ! The worst bit for me was the tight under chin strap !, so I moved it to my chin and felt more comfortable.  Wendy x
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat, have you started your chemo yet? we can compare cold cap results ! Wendyx
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, Thats worrying that the first 15 minutes was painful, as mine wasnt, so now wondering if it wasnt fitted correctly ! or wasnt cold enough ! Its brilliant news that youve kept most of your hair, you must be so relieved ! I just hope it works for me too ! Good luck with the other 2 chemos, can I ask why you have to have 8? I have to have 6 or is that just the norm in your hospital? Best wishes, Wendyx
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: Mine was sore when mine decided to go, was quite long, so shaved it to about 1" and still have alot of that 1" after 3 chemo sessions, do have some patches that are slightly bald though ! When I wash it, I uses a very mild shampoo, and I have found Tea tree conditioner really soothing on the scalp.  It hasnt got sore at all after my 3rd chemo, and Im due another one in two days time, so, not sure if it was the tea tree conditioner or not, but maybe worth a try. Wendy
Posts.Title: very tender scalp due too chemo...suggestions?

Posts.Content: Thanks Irene, I seem to want to be able to run before I can walk as they say! How long before you felt confident to drive ? at the moment my arm wont go any further than half way up ! Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy immediate reconstruction with implants please h...

Posts.Content: Hi there, sorry to hear your bad news, Im on a similar journey, just had a single mastectomy and axillary node clearance, Ive had the chest expander implant put in as there was no room left for an implant, its been 2 weeks now, and its the expander that gives me the most grief! it is higher than the scar tissue, and is so uncomfortable, and its not even pumped up at all yet ! I cant answer your question, but am interested to read any of your replies, as Im beginning to regret having anything put in at all ! I would like to hear from anyone with an expander implant, to hear how long that takes to settle down.
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy immediate reconstruction with implants please h...

Posts.Content: Hi, its been 7 weeks since my last TAX, and just lost 2 x toenails this week ! also my fingernails are really sore now, they didnt hurt during the chemo, they are a sickly yellow colour and half detached, so looks like they could fall off too soon, along with my very sore 8 toenails !! so beware, the nail pain can go on for a longish time after TAX, and the nails can come off at even a later stage. Mine hurt whilst Im typing this !! Good luck, yours may not come off at all, just letting you know the possibilities ! I did paint mine black all through chemo too, didnt seem to help though ! Best wishes, Wendy x
Posts.Title: Docetaxel / Finger nails

Posts.Content: Hi, yes its normal to take 4 steroids in the morning and 4 again before 2pm, day before Tax and on day of tax and day after. Im on my 2nd Tax and last ones on Thursday, still wake up at 5a.m. every morning!! takes you a while to get back into normal sleep pattern! Good luck with Tax, its not been too kind to me, but bearable!!! Best wishes Wendy
Posts.Title: Living alone

Posts.Content: Hi Michele, I am at the same hospital as you (Norfolk & Norwich) and Ive just completed chemo and finished radiotherapy yesterday. I asked my Oncologist if I was to have scan after, but he told me no too. When I asked why, he said you have no other symptoms. How he knows I have no other symptoms, I dont know ! I think we have to wait and see if we get any symptoms before they offer us a scan! Its is nothing to do with being triple negative kittykat, as I am also and had 5cm invasive tumour with 1 lymph node involved, so I reckon its just different hospital policies. I am now in limbo land, not knowing if its spread or not ! same as you Michele! I think its to do with financial cuts at our hospital, I have heard they are in a bit of trouble financially and scans are expensive. Hope all goes well for you Wendy x
Posts.Title: How do I know if its spread?

Posts.Content: Hi there Ive had 3 lots of FEC chemo, about to have taxotare today, so dont know how i will feel with that one yet, but with FEC the usual one they start you on, I found I was well to work the 3rd week, properly, the 2nd week I felt a bit better but didnt quite well enough to go to work all that week (did 2 days only), I suppose 10 days I didnt feel like going to work after each chemo session. Thats me, other people are different, my problems really were on the gastric side, bad constipation, then the opposite ! and weakness. I think this is quite common with most people, some manage to work, some dont, so it depends on your reaction and maybe finances pushing you to go back ! Im glad I went back, takes your mind of the big C for a while anyway ! Hope all goes well for you Wendy x
Posts.Title: Will I be able to work through treatment?

Posts.Content: Hi Sue, had the doxatel or taxodare whatever they call it, this morning 9 am, went ok, no allergic reations, feel slightly sick now, so just took a domperidone, to try and settle it and a glass of ginger ale ! More steroid tomorrow, then awaiting the side effects that everyone on here is mentioning ! oh dear ! Will update you by PM later on in the week ! Its very difficult on here, as I dont appear to get all the emails from breast cnacer group anymore since their bug in the system, and can only get whats happening by looking everything up, and it still wont let me go back a page only can read the last page, very infuriating, I have told them about it, but to no avail, so if I cant find you again, do PM me ! Hugs Wendy xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Will I be able to work through treatment?

Posts.Content: Hello Trish, Sorry to butt in on this thread, but wondering if you could give me some advise, I am booked in for MX and axillary node clearance in 2 weeks time, after the  SNB they found 1 node out of the 2 infected. How are you getting on? especially with the node clearance, Im still pretty sore after the SNB taking out just 2 nodes, Im dreading them removing all of them (and my breast as well of course!) All this lymphodema  that you can get afterwards terrifies me, Im thinking Im always going to have a large swollen arm ! surgeon says even if you get an insect bite it can swell up, and mozzies just love me ! How are you coping after the MX and clearance? I have invasive dcis grade 2 or above (they cant tell me until theyve removed it, so not sure yet, )also lump 4cm roughly is all I know . Im having expansion implant at the same time, but they said not sure if I will need chem or rads yet till after MX. Bit worried about possibility of no chem/rads as everyone else here seems to have had it ! Can you advise me what I should expect after the operation? thanks Wendy
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Angie, thanks for the recommendation for sweeties, have written a shopping list !  What type of reconstruction did you have? and how is it going?  poor you 2 types of cancers, Ive got IDC but has spread to 1 lymph node that they know of from SNB, hence the clearance with the MX on Friday. Hope the chemo finishes soon, so you will feel a bit better very soon. Sending a big hug ! Wendy x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: hi janice,  Thanks for the advise, got the sweeties on my list now, got to find a heart shaped cushion now....... , not sure where to get that yet ! but will try before friday, unfortunately working till Thursday, so not sure what time Ive got to go cushion hunting !  Ipod downloading as we speak ! Thanks again ! wendy x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, thanks for your advice regarding the node clearance, Ive made a mental note to ensure I do the excercises ! I dont know as yet if I will need chemo or rads they said they wont know till after the MX, I think they said I wouldnt have Herceptin or Tamoxifen because tumour wasnt oestrogen positive. I may be wrong here, but I think thats what they said ! I will find out more afterwards I suppose. Thanks for the hug, and sending you one too ! Wendy x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Ok then, no nighties, need pants though or bum will show at back of gown !!! they let you wear them dont they? W x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Thank you Janice, so kind of you ! Ive added you to friends so I can PM you ! and Ok added make up to list !!! Wendy x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, Thanks for that, had loads of visitors tonight, wishing me well, so nice ! I will write again as soon as I am out of hospital!!! Might have to type with left hand only ? all will become clearer then ! Best wishes to you  xxxxx Wendy
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Trish Date for op looming, (next Friday) now getting the jitters already ! I have just got out a bag and have put in 2 x nighties and 1 pair of PJs, several pants and wash bag and a book. What else do I need?? any advice? How are you feeling now? are you still very sore? Wishing you the best results for your scan  and fingers crossed it will be clear. Its strange, I never felt any tenderness or pain with my lump, but since the core biopsy and the SNB removal. Ive had painful boob, gone hard and a funny colour around the nipple, sort of yellow ! wasnt like that before ! I asked BC nurse she said it was probably bruising, I dont know but it now looks like I have got something really weird going on in there !  When do you start your rads? before the scan or afterwards? Good luck with it all, Big hug ! Wendy
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Well so kind of you Vicky ! I have just given Janice my address and she is going to send me the cushion ! I am hoping the hospital will give me a bag, not sure yet, they havent told me anything ! apart from I will have drains ! I will be going into the Norfolk and Norwich University hospital, not sure if they give me a bag to hang my drains in or not ! surely they must give me something to put them in???????????? Maybe I will ring and find out tomorrow ! has anyone else here been to that hospital??? maybe they can tell me?????? Thanks again Vicky Big Hug, hope you are doing ok, with your treatment, Wendy x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: I will give them a ring tomorrow and see, probably would prefer to be in Hospital with the drains as I have a large dog and knowing him hes bound to catch them ! A friend is looking after him while Im in hospital, but will bring him back when Im home, so probably would be best to stay in ! Another thing to find out ! Thanx  Wendy x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, Ive now got most things sorted for Friday, will get some nibbles to go in bag too, thats a good idea. Just got home from work, and took the dog for a walk, lovely day so warm ! Typical, weather changing when Im about to go in hospital ! I am not finishing work until the day before I go in, thought it best to keep busy so I dont keep thinking too much ! (I usually get home by 3.30 as Im only part time now) Got to be at hospital by 7 a.m. on Friday, and its about 3/4 hour drive, so early start !  Fingers crossed for you with the scan, and hopefully I will be back from hospital before you start your rads ! I hope you dont mind but ive sent you a friend invite, would be nice to keep in touch, as I keep losing people on here, find it difficult to remember where ive been and havent !! Hopefully chat again soon !!! big hug Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: p.s. Trish..... I have just read your "more about me" Love it ! its great youve still got your sense of humour after all your going through ! xx Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Trish, Ive got a very large, very soppy rottweiler, called Alfie, so I am hoping he will help me get back to walking out with him across the fields in stages ! start short walks to start I expect ,and then get longer, thats how it was when I had my hysterectomy. Luckily he is not a "puller" and just toddles along next to me. I think having him, making me walk out each day really helped my recovery as they did say walk as much as you can, excercise is good. (but didnt mention painful !) Well, going to have an early night, went to work at 8 am, got home at 3.30, then walked dog fro 3/4 hour, then spent most of the evening on the phone, (plus 1 visitor) its amazing how many people keep ringing me, word gets round to people who I havent seen or spoken to for years and they are popping up all over the place! I didnt even get time to cook any dinner, just made do just now with 4 x crumpets ! just had another call  so back again now ! Think I will go to bed now, read for a while, I get so tired out now, that I can sleep all night again (didnt when first got diagnosis, was sleeping only a couple of hours a night) started taking those KALMS tablets, they are brilliant (for me anyway), I dont really feel stressed out since taking them, and I sleep better too.  Well goodnight for now, and I will be in touch ! I have sent you a friend request, if you accept it I wont lose you !  night,  Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Fiona, I dont think they will, as you wont have anything to fight it with after chemo, best to call chemo unit and ask them before going, they may delay it a week. I had a chest infection, and they delayed mine for 1 week. All the best, Wendy x
Posts.Title: Will they do chemo with a cold?

Posts.Content: Hi Sasha, Ive had them since MX surgery too,had total hysterectomy 4 years ago, with not much trouble but have been getting really bad night sweats, getting a bit better now though, only get them occasionally. I had surgery end of March. I dont know if its normal though ! I dont think its anything to do with being ER+ because I am triple negative. I thought it was a bit odd too as Ive not had hormone meds for about a year. Maybe its normal, lets see what the others say ........................
Posts.Title: Hot flashes post MX - no hormone treatment

Posts.Content: I was offered it, but I said it was a long journey to come in for placebo, but my Oncologist said he would ensure I was on the rads, not the placebo side of the trial. which I finish tomorrow ! 15 of them thank goodness its over. I did ask what % having rads after MX and chemo offered and he said 15% extra protection, so went ahead with it. The other trial I was offered, was having 6 treatments instead of 15 but asked for the 15, as wanted the most protection, not sure what this trial was called though. Anyway, will all be done and finished with tomorrow, and now I know I have done everything I could possibly have done to try and stop this recurring, so heres hoping................................
Posts.Title: Supremo Trial for Radiotherapy
